While Joseph was gone to Pilate for the Saviour's body, Nicodemus was making ready for the burial. It was the 
                                                                           150
custom in those times to wrap the bodies of the dead in linen cloths, with precious ointments and sweet spices. This was one method of embalming. So Nicodemus brought a costly gift of about a hundred pounds' weight of myrrh and aloes for the body of Jesus.
